Title: The endings of relationships between people with learning disabilities and their keyworkers
Source: Unexpected Gains: Psychotherapy with People with Learning Disabilities
Abstract: © 2004 David Simpson & Lynda Miller.“A keyworker is a friend that you can turn to, and it’s a friend who I can talk to when I’ve got problems, like what I’m talking to you about, about what has happened in my life-you know, because a lot of things have happened-They’re helpful, so to that end it makes one feel that they are different to all the others, and it means that I can turn to them when I’ve got that many problems or whatever.”.
